keyword: calories in a cupcake with icing
title: Calories in a Cupcake with Icing
meta_description: Discover calories in a cupcake with icing, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations under 160 characters.
h1: Calories in a Cupcake with Icing
assumptions: Standard vanilla cupcake (~50 g) with vanilla buttercream icing (~20 g), baked from mix, no fillings or decorations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, frosting type, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical cupcake with icing contains about 250 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cupcake with icing?
faqs.a: About 250 kcal for a standard size with vanilla buttercream.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cupcake with icing?
faqs.a: Around 35 g total carbs, including 25 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a cupcake with icing high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 12 g fat, with 5 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does icing affect calories in a cupcake?
faqs.a: Icing adds ~100 kcal, mostly from sugar and fat.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie options for cupcakes with icing?
faqs.a: Yes, use lighter frosting or smaller size to reduce to under 200 kcal.
